meta.mt2: Paul's first letter to the believers in

meta.ip: This is Paul's first letter to the believers in Corinth that we have in our Bibles, but could easily have been his second letter to them. We deduce this from his reference to other letters, e.g., see https://www.GotQuestions.org/how-many-letters-Corinthians.html, but we don't have copies of them.

In this letter from Paul to the believers in Corinth, he wrote about his time preaching in Ephesus. He wrote this in order to help with problems experienced by various groups of believers that he founded there in Corinth. Corinth was the mother city of province of Achaia—Achaia was a province of Rome. At that time, Corinth was a large city that Greeks, Romans, and Jews all lived in. Ne from because ilis sika of dahat, many also the egmangendiye board of ships the egpamelegye and egpameli. Nabantug the sika city tenged of karatu din, and many the various religion of mahinged dutu, and many also the egmeyibhilabetey dutu and the following of tapey batasan like that. Hapit migdaruwa year(s) Paul the Lived there in order to preaching, and many the believed (Acts 18).

Peglihad of me three year(s), while of there Paul of Ephesus the egwali, nakarawat sikandin of letter from believers there to Corinth (1 Cor. 7:1). Nakarineg again sikandin concerning the ehetanan of believers and of other pad problems ran there to group of believers. Te this letter, advised din them concerning due and egpepaaween din that egmeyibhilabetey sakup of group dan of believers. He answered again that questions concerning the marriage, widows, gifts of Spirit of God, and the peg-uyag of me minatey.
Te chapter 13, nahuhud due that love, iyan sika the subla good gift of God there to people din. Ne kema ke sika iya the very ipanengneng of this document.
